content.description:
Starts with a little over hung bulge and just follow the crack all the way up to the top.

 Try the 5.hard TR in between the two routes by avoiding the big crack!

Climb up into the big corner and feel free to use some stemming to get up through there. If you dont have a good hold then you must be doing something wrong. Enjoy the glory holds and the ending as well!
content.location: This is the route in the corner when you first enter the canyon. Great time through out the whole climb.

content.description: If top roping its recommended to bring some slings to extend the anchor over the edge. the only spot that really gets verticle is when you climb around the roof. The movement is better going up the left rather than the right side even though the bolt is on the right side. Walking up steps start.
content.location: Middle route up the stairway ramp.

content.description: Basically a scramble up steps. Good for the kids to start learning how to be on rocks.
content.location: Far right up with a bit of a ledge start.

content.description: 70 m rope recommended although a 60 will do just fine if you want to just walk down the steps. The crux is up at the top.
content.location: Left most route of the stairway ramp area.

content.description: West and North facing routes. Rock isnt super high quality but especially the far right routes in the canyon are great to teach kids and beginners the basics of climbing. Not a major destination for those that are looking for strong moves and big whips. But very safe and easy to climb. Bring some runners to help with rope drag on the 2 taller routes!
